SEARCH

Class GameCharacter

java.lang.Object
GameCharacter
public class GameCharacter extends Object
Character.

A class to contain all of the data for the player character, might be useful to also act as a class or base class for NPCs.

  • Constructor Summary

    GameCharacter(String nameInput, HashMap<String,Boolean> itemsInput, String locationInput, int healthInput, int maxHealthInput, int minDamageInput, int maxDamageInput)

  • Constructor Details

    • GameCharacter

      public GameCharacter(String nameInput, HashMap<String,Boolean> itemsInput, String locationInput, int healthInput, int maxHealthInput, int minDamageInput, int maxDamageInput)
      The constructor for the GameCharacter class.
      Parameters:
      nameInput - what to set the character's name to, as a String
      itemsInput - what to set the character's inventory to, as a HashMap of Strings and Booleans
      locationInput - what to set the character's location to, as a String
      healthInput - what to set the character's health to, as an int
      maxHealthInput - what to set the character's maximum health to, as an int
      minDamageInput - what to set the character's minimum damage to, as an int
      maxDamageInput - what to set the character's maximum damage to, as an int

  • Method Details

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Method to take damage, lowering the character's health by the amount of damage taken, also ensure that health does not go below 0.
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage taken, and the amount to reduce health by.

    • heal

      public void heal(int amount)
      Method to heal health by a given amount, does not go over maximum health.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to heal, if this plus health is above maxHealth then the remainder will be wasted.

    • attack

      public int attack()
      Method to make an attack roll. Very basic as it only checks for the existence of the sword (working name) in the character's inventory, then deals a range of damage based on whether or not that item is in the character's inventory. Can be reworked with layered if statements to automatically pick highest damage dealing item if multiple weapons are implemented though.
      Returns:
      the amount of damage dealt to the opponent.

    • listInventory

      public void listInventory()
      Method to get all collected items in the Character's inventory and displays the string to the output.

    • getInventory

      public String[] getInventory()
      Method to get a list of all collected items in the Character's inventory then return it as an array of strings.
      Returns:
      an array of items in the Character's inventory that are true/collected
